data.name: Guess the Passtune
data.description:
The passtune is an array of 5 notes which will open the castle drawbridge.
Each note may be one of ['A','B','C','D','E','F','G']. (Each note could be used more than once)
You must create a class named Tourist to guess the correct passtune.
The improvise method will be used to guess a tune.

```ruby
tourist.improvise   # returns a 5-note array like ['B','C','C','F','A']
```

After each guess, tourist.callback will be passed a hash containing the number of tumbler clicks & gear turns heard coming from the castle.

```ruby
tourist.callback(  { :tumbler_clicks => 3, :gear_turns => 1 }  )
```

There will be one tumber click for each correct note in the wrong place.
There will be one gear turn for each correct note in the correct place.

Here is an example of how the Tourist class will be used:

```ruby
castle  = Castle.new
tourist = Tourist.new
until castle.open? do
  castle.open_drawbridge( tourist.improvise )
  tourist.callback( castle.sounds )
end
```

Can you guess the passtune in 38 turns or less?
